title: (x) Ferrell International logo - ITC Serif Gothic {Yves, Patrick Broderick}
content:
I know I have see this font in the past but I can’t find it now. I need the name. I’m having a hard time finding because it has characteristics of a modern sans serif but with serifs. Your help would be greatly appreciated.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Ferrell 2006 logo + type MAC.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20060512045554/http:/typophile.com/files/Ferrell%202006%20logo%20+%20type%20MAC.jpg) | 618.3 KB |
author: payback99

comments.content:
![](http://web.archive.org/files/Ferrell-2006-logo-type-MAC_5433.jpg)
Posted a new image. There was a problem with the first one.
I would categorise it as a geometric glyphic sans (structure of a sans with tiny sharp serifs). But I wouldn’t know if that category even exists.
